units.title: Generate metacells integrating transcriptome and chromatin accessibility data
units.text: we integrated the two modalities by constructing metacells containing both transcriptome and chromatin accessibility information, defining a total of 24 clusters from 35,499 metacells (Fig. 4a and Supplementary Table 3).
units.rationale: This is a key methodological step in data integration for single-cell analysis, involving explicit construction of metacells from two modalities.

units.title: Infer cell trajectories using CellRank with pseudotime and RNA velocity
units.text: To follow cell trajectories over time, we used CellRank47 to infer the terminal macrostates (myocytic, epicardial, endothelial and endodermal) and the probability of each cell to transition toward these states based on both pseudotime and RNA velocity information (Fig. 4b and Extended Data Fig. 7a).
units.rationale: This describes a specific computational protocol for trajectory inference using CellRank, combining pseudotime and RNA velocity, which is a core analytical method.

units.title: Differentiate epicardioids and track lineage markers over time
units.text: Epicardioids differentiated from AAVS1-FRT-flanked STOP-mKate2-HA reporter hiPSCs were transduced with a lentiviral vector encoding FLP under the control of the CDH1 promoter at day 15 before analysis at day 24.
units.rationale: This is a precise, actionable protocol step for lineage tracing in epicardioids, specifying cell line, genetic construct, timing, and transduction method.

units.title: Treat epicardioids with endothelin-1 to induce hypertrophy and fibrosis
units.text: we treated 1-month-old epicardioids with endothelin-1 (ET1), a potent vasoconstrictor known to induce hypertrophy in vivo and in vitro.
units.rationale: This describes a direct experimental intervention to model disease phenotype, with specific agent and timing, qualifying as a protocol unit.

units.title: Perform immunostaining to detect epicardial and cardiac markers
units.text: Epicardioids were analyzed by immunostaining for the HA tag, the CM marker cTnT and the mesenchymal marker vimentin (top) or the HA tag, vimentin and the SMC marker calponin (CNN1; bottom) in infected organoids at day 24.
units.rationale: This provides a detailed, step-specific immunostaining protocol with exact markers, timing, and tissue context, essential for experimental reproducibility.

units.title: Analyze calcium transients and arrhythmic events in epicardioids
units.text: Calcium imaging in ET1-treated epicardioid slices additionally revealed CM dysfunction across the myocardial layers, including frequent arrhythmic events and decreased calcium transient amplitudes.
units.rationale: This describes a functional assay protocol involving calcium imaging and detection of arrhythmic events, a key physiological readout in the study.

units.title: Validate ISL1 expression in human fetal heart tissue
units.text: we performed ISL1 immunostaining in human fetal heart tissue to verify this finding. This revealed that epicardial cells were indeed positive for ISL1 at 5 weeks after conception, but expression was lost by 6 weeks.
units.rationale: This is a specific validation protocol using immunostaining on human fetal tissue with defined developmental timepoints, critical for biological relevance.
